website_summaries.verdict: A great pair of good-looking headphones that offer a stylish accent when wearing them in public.
pros: Excellent sound isolation provided by the closed back design of the ear cans
cons: Overall sound quality is a bit lackluster compared to other budget options

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, but short-lived
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones in September and loved them until the right side completely stopped working after 3 months of moderate use. It is a real bummer, because these are some of the comfiest headphones I've ever had. Did not have a single issue with them until one day they stopped working on one side so I would say use it with caution.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Right side stopped working after five months.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones five months ago. They are comfortable, look good, and have good sound for the price. That was until a week ago when the right side stopped working. These headphones live on my desk at work, they have not been through anything rough and other than lifting them and placing them on my head there is no reason they should have stopped working. Unacceptable. I have a pair of the K240s at home that I have had for close to two years with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Young

customer_reviews.title: These are very good headphones. Give no regard to snippy, picky, snotty reviews.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, rich and clear sound. I'm listening right now to some acoustic Latin music. Bright and clean guitars, percussion and bass with crisp vocals. For me, these are great! I have no real experience with super high-end studio headphones but, I certainly can hear the difference between these and those of lesser quality that I've had. Comfortable? Yes. Wellmade? Yes. No snobby, quasi-technical complaints here. I got these at an open box discount and love them. I listen first thing in the morning to get my spirits up and to look forward to a hope-filled great day! How 'bout that?!
customer_reviews.author: PaulV

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding headphones
customer_reviews.text: Headphones were a Christmas gift for our son to use with his electronic drum kit. They worked great...initially. In the middle of playing, the right earpiece suddenly went out. Connecting the headphones to other devices didn't help. After fooling around with them, if the metal bands along the top were squeezed together, the sound returned to the right earpiece. After letting go, the sound was gone again. Evidently there is a short somewhere in the headphones. A replacement pair is being sent so hopefully they will last longer. Also, no...the volume was not cranked up and they weren't stepped on etc...
customer_reviews.author: Cheri W. Fertig

customer_reviews.title: Jaw dropping sound quality!
customer_reviews.text: Stunning sound quality. I've never heard any sound system or headphone handle bass as well as these. These do such a good job articulating layered sounds that it was like listening to all my music for the first time again. The depth of sound is amazing. My taste in music has actually changed because of the sound quality. The only downside is that they clamp on my ears a little harder than I'm used to and my jaw eventually gets a little tired pushing back. Not a big deal, and totally worth the sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like a pair of Coke cans...
customer_reviews.text: Please don't buy these... I put them up against a pair of Yamaha's I got here in my office and they failed the test in 5 seconds of listening to them on my Behringer Ms40 Studio monitors. Bought them yesterday and if I could have caught the UPS guy when he dropped them off before he left I could have got him to return them at same d#$! time....lol. Thank you Amazon for giving my money back. Don't buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: 8 months using
customer_reviews.text: I have had these a while and comfort is what I truly give 5 stars for. I am already an AKG fan so the other things I do not care for although I do need them. I still hear through the headphones but that is fine for me as I do not record with 2 ears on, others do but I need to hear myself sing. Sound quality is not mediocre, I look for bass and clarity, may mot be the search of others but this is my preference when buying headphones of any kind.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie McAfee

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headphones
customer_reviews.text: TL;DR - These headphones are phenomenal. Sound quality is great, and when sound is playing, you can hear a thing, so it makes them noise cancelling. Extremely comfortable, I can wear them for hours at a time. Great headphones for sound producers or people looking for great headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Cahill

customer_reviews.title: ... a big fat head and don't want to feel like it has been put in a vice by your ...
customer_reviews.text: If you have a big fat head and don't want to feel like it has been put in a vice by your headset these are for you. The long cord is nice and does not tangle. Sound quality is great assuming you don't work in a recording studio in which case you'll want a slightly wider frequency response range. They also don't suffer from the stethoscope phenomenon most over the ear headsets suffer from. I played Borderlands 2 four about 05:00:00 straight and had no comfort issues and as I said I've go an uncommonly large skull.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Possibly Faulty Pair?
customer_reviews.text: these headphones sound like im trying to listen to music with ear plugs on. everything is absolutely muffled. it sounds this way one multiple devices. worst sounding pair of headphones i've ever worn. unless i HEAVILY EQ this headset, its unlistenable in any context. the only way to make these sound good is to max out the highest frequencies so it doesn't sound like I'm listening to music through a closed door. even then it often sounds tinny.
customer_reviews.author: AnononAmazon

customer_reviews.title: ... would have to say these might be the overall best in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: I own many pair of headphones and I would have to say these might be the overall best in my opinion. While the bass is not heavy like the Beats Studio 2.0 or Sony XTRA bass, it is accurate. The best thing about these headphones are the vocals and mids. I am hearing details that I cannot hear on my other headphones (that includes all BOSE headphones I own.) These are fairly new headphones for AKG but I would highly recommend to give them a go; especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Kosterman

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality and comfort are much better than earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Headphones help me stay sane at my cubicle and reduce background noise without blocking it. I can still hear coworkers trying to get my attention or talking to me. Sound quality and comfort are much better than earbuds. Great value for the price. I'm glad I didn't a $200-$300 model. Cons: Press on my ears a little, which gets uncomfortable after a few hours. Not ideal if you want complete silence.
customer_reviews.author: L. Helinski

customer_reviews.title: By far the worst
customer_reviews.text: Audio quality is terrible. Highs and mids are disgraceful and don't get me started on how pathetic the bass is. I got some $40 off brand OneOdio and they rival my $400 beats by dre headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Djmeechymeech

customer_reviews.title: Great set of headphones for a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: These compare to much more expensive headphones. Very light on your head and comfortable to wear for a long time. Sound quality equal to K240 series, even a little better IMO. A little cheaply built, so you have to take care of them, probably won't stand up to frequent tossing or dropping around the studio for long. I've had the K52 as well, and these are a little better, so it's worth a few extra bucks. Overall, great headphones for mixing, recording, and super comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are my first pair of studio headphones. The sound quality is lightyears ahead of typical consumer grade headphones. The headphones are nice and lightweight. My only complaint would be the pads are a little uncomfortable for long periods of wear. I think I might be looking to upgrade those, but overall I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: AJC

customer_reviews.title: Stop working in one ear after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Shoddy construction. Sound great if they work in both ears. the connection to the right ear is really awful. The connection is made over the headband (no wires) which is really cool and works fine. The issue is with the wire they use to connect the headband to the speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Premium comfort for a budget price
customer_reviews.text: I got these to use as monitors for my video conferencing setup. I picked them because they are from a line of headphones that are light weight, comfortable, and extremely non fatiguing. They really delivered. THe build quality is not amazing but the lightness is a big plus. I can wear these for hours and hours and the most fatiguing aspect is that they are closed back, but that's what I want so the mic doesn't pick up my audio. The audio quality is about what you woudl expect from $40 cans. I probably wouldn't have bought these at the $70 MSRP, but the sale price heck yes.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and good sounding cans
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use in my office at work. For general listening purposes these headphones are pretty dang good. Nice, balanced sound without too much bass or harsh treble and an overall clear sound, comfortable enough to wear for most of the workday (and I have a pretty big noggin), etc. I wouldn't personally do any mixing work or super critical listening with these, but for general purpose headphones they're excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Brown

customer_reviews.title: Sound great, super comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I did some research before buying. I’ve always wanted over the ear headphones, but they are expensive. This pair is affordable, has a good sound quality, and are super comfortable. I’ve been wearing them all day at work and haven’t had any issue. Comes with the headphone input and the bigger guy for like amps and things. If this is your price range and you value comfort, these are the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Faye

customer_reviews.title: No Adjustable Slider for the Length of Headband
customer_reviews.text: Since there are some loosen gaps when I wear the headphone, I can hear sound from outside. This headphone does not have the adjustable slider which I usually adjust for the length. I wish at least I can adjust the position of the middle connected headband.
customer_reviews.author: kay lee

customer_reviews.title: Very nice can of headphone
customer_reviews.text: Very nice can of headphone. Light and comfortable, except your ears will feel a little bit too warm when wearing this headphone for more than 1 hours. Its sound quality is great but the volume needs to be slightly higher in my opinion. But pairing this headphone with the tiny Fiio E6 fixes my problem.
customer_reviews.author: Hai Tran

customer_reviews.title: Good for its price
customer_reviews.text: Really good durable headphones for its price. I`m not a DJ or any other kind of professional to judge about the sound, but for me as a simple home user it`s good enough. I miss only removable audio cable.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitrii K.

customer_reviews.title: Great for guitar amp and turntable use
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these specifically for quiet practice for an electric guitar and for turntable (listening only). Love the closed back feature, very useful for use with the guitar, and helps when just listening through the turntable to isolate recording. Light, easy self-adjusting band, and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: These headphones sound awful.
customer_reviews.text: If these sounded even as good as a pair of $15 earbuds I might have kept them. They don't. They have some sort of resonance from the plastic enclosure that makes everything sound veiled, boxy, and ultimately unmusical. They look nice and are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Boswell

customer_reviews.title: Good for $50
customer_reviews.text: Good for general media and decent for music. Drivers are powerful and driver a lot of air, but the midrange is boxy and the sound isolation is below average for closed back causing sound leakage and lowered bass response.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: They were OK. Very lgihtweight. Interesting suspension/padding system.
customer_reviews.text: They were OK. Very lgihtweight. Interesting suspension/padding system. Didn't like them enough to keep them.
customer_reviews.author: stardust

customer_reviews.title: It's worth the investment!
customer_reviews.text: I liked that they're not too expensive for someone just starting out in the podcasting world, and they're comfortable. I guess my only concern would be how long the elastic band on the top would last if I have to make adjustments every now and then. Overall, happy with the product!
customer_reviews.author: Maria A Pena

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: These sound like a much more expensive pair of headphones. The reproduction is remarkable accurate. They are sturdy without being too heavy, and are well-designed, comfortable enough to wear for hours, and large enough to completely contain the ears, doing a good job of blocking extraneous noises.
customer_reviews.author: amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: great deal on very capable headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this headphone for a couple years now and they are super comfortable because of the way the headgear stretches and the sound is fine for the home recording I do. the only drawback is where the cord attaches to the headphones is easily broken or should I say the little wires inside break easily so I put a loop and tape it to the headphones now so if the accidental pulling of the cord doesn't immediately break the wires. standard 1/4 " plug would be much better
customer_reviews.author: Super-b-3

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is great, and he says they are the most comfortable ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my son since I have used several pairs of AKG headphones in the studio. The sound quality is great, and he says they are the most comfortable headphones he has ever worn. Plus they have a heavy duty cord which seems to be holding up much better under the teenager abuse they receive.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Good phones for the money
customer_reviews.text: The AKG K72 headphones are both comfortable and good sounding. They fit over the ear with lots of room to spare. The sound quality is very good, with brightness and sonic clarity. Overall an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Tim R.

customer_reviews.title: Know before you buy.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these, they're comfortable, nice to look at, etc. For studio headphones, they're awfully colored and quiet. Would not recommend for anyone seriously considering them for music production; the built-in EQ will throw you completely off. For the price that I got them ($35), they are fine for listening. For $100, these are NOT studio quality.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: like bass. If the bass needed enhancement
customer_reviews.text: Finally some headphones that play the actual sound and don't assume that they need to enhance something, like bass. If the bass needed enhancement, the musicians or the studio would have added it.
customer_reviews.author: Parkuhr

customer_reviews.title: He likes them!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband. He says the sound is great, but best of all, they are very comfortable around his ears.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina D.

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly good considering the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price these are exceptionally good headphones. I have been using them to mix multi-track music and though they may not be strictly speaking 'flat response' I examined their frequency response tests and am satisfied that for closed headphones they have the right colouration that would be expected for these type of cans. AKG have alaways made the best professional audio and I am very pleased to possess these K92 for recording and mixing purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice cheap headphones.
customer_reviews.text: They feel kinda flimsy and cheap but they sound great for what they cost and they don't give me a headache after wearing them for a few hours. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones! They are affordable and great for home studios, you won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Trollie

customer_reviews.title: First of I will admit these headphones are a great piece of hardware
customer_reviews.text: First of I will admit these headphones are a great piece of hardware. The metal headband is flexible yet sturdy, and the way it sits on your head is super comfortable. But. The sound quality for the price is a dealbreaker. Very little bass and the highs kind of distort into that hollowish sound. Maybe I got a bad pair, but I will be returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Armand Arana

customer_reviews.title: Right side stopped working after a 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Decent sound quality initially but they only lasted 3 months until the right side stopped working. I've had headphones that lasted 15 years so this is unacceptable. Surprised these haven't been pulled immediately. Stay away
customer_reviews.author: Jacob A.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift and the teen loves them. Not a lot of bass, which was his preference.
customer_reviews.author: christina l. ard

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable good sound, I bought them from the used section they came without the adapter which is disappointing but the headphones themselves are quality.
customer_reviews.author: James Ranger

customer_reviews.title: 2nd time buying these!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, these are really great! Especially if you are a beginning music producer or just really like watching movies.
customer_reviews.author: corrinne smith

customer_reviews.title: HUH. Can not hear you!!!!
customer_reviews.text: No complaints from the husband. Cancels noise as it says. Husband says the sound is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: One of the worst headphones I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: While comfy, everything sounds muffled. I don't know what headphones the other commenters got, but it certainly wasn't this one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound.
customer_reviews.text: AKG is iconic and very cheap, but awesome quality, a little too warm, but great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Esteban Bonilla

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, exept in the lower basses
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, exept in the lower basses, but thise are rare. Feels great on the ears and the noise cancelling is practically total.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Wear all day
customer_reviews.text: Have had many Headphones in my studio these for price and comfort can't be beat
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: This product is pretty good. If your looking for headphones to drown out outside sound, these are not for you. It is not noise counseling but it has good sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I think they're great sounding!
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I have small ears but they fit nicely for me. No comfort issues at all. I like the sound. Bought to replace K 44's that stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Play 💋

customer_reviews.title: Great value headphones for home or office use
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair of these to listen to music in the office when I need to concentrate. They sit comfortably without being too tight. For the price they're great. They keep out the chatter and other office noice great. They're quite loud so you don't need your volume turned very high. I'm no audiophile, they sound good enough for what I need. I think they look pretty cool too. Simple and understated. For around $40 I doubt you'll find much better
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Myers

customer_reviews.title: Sound great for the price, good budget monitors for musicians
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding headphones for the price. I use them as monitors for a keyboard mixer workstation in my home. Picks up pretty nicely where my old AKGs left off.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: headphones fills very cheap with a bad build quality
customer_reviews.text: Got it with a disconnected cord, headphones fills very cheap with a bad build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Adar Tzivion

customer_reviews.title: AKG, the good ones.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value. Not a lot of money but a lot of sound/range/quality!
customer_reviews.author: DooDah Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy construction with great comfort
customer_reviews.text: This is really well balanced sounding pair of headphones. Very sturdy construction with great comfort.
customer_reviews.author: CK P.

customer_reviews.title: Only lasts 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones and they worked perfectly fine...for 3 months, at which point the right headphone died irreparably. You can certainly spend your money on headphones that last a lot longer than this.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Massey

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sound. Durable. The cord is very long and I have to wind it up for daily use. The headphones themselves are a bit too big for my liking, but quite comfortable. Good for larger ears.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Back-up headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great bang for your buck. I do wish that the fidelity was a bit better, but comfortable to wear and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur J. Spinetti

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and comfort
customer_reviews.text: The recipient loves them! We bought them for our son, and then dad had to have them too.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is amazing
customer_reviews.text: You cannot beat the sound quality for the price. Although I use them for gaming, as an ex music engineer, the sounds are comparable to some of the most expensive in the industry. Highly recommend these pair!!
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Decent.
customer_reviews.text: They are lightweight but material seems cheap, but overall they are comfortable and have a decent sound for the price. Yes there's better, but like they say you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: adrian

customer_reviews.title: Short life, bad quality after only 4 months of use
customer_reviews.text: The right side is losing connection and not working after only 4 months of use...what quality is this. Couldn't believe AKG is making such poor quality products. Disappointed and won't consider AKG any more.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Sun

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: These are great for the sale price of $39.00. They really benefit from a headphone amp.
customer_reviews.author: Virgil

customer_reviews.title: muddy sound
customer_reviews.text: Used them with my irig2 my laptop and iPod, sounds muddy on all 3 devices
customer_reviews.author: kc

customer_reviews.title: So comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never had better headphones. I use these to edit/mix my film and audio projects.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great set of cans for starting out. The sound quality is good and the comfort is great. Definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Banana slices

customer_reviews.title: Good if you aren't expecting studio quality sound.
customer_reviews.text: I was anticipating a better bass sound. I have another set of in ears that came with my phone but by this same brand that sound amazing. For a pair of over ears I was expecting much richer sounds.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Great everyday no amp cans
customer_reviews.text: Great everyday wear cans. Affordable and clean looking enough to feel confident leaving at my office. Love high end AKG and these have been a great addition for amp less use.
customer_reviews.author: Vinny

customer_reviews.title: Tantalizing Bass
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great for any kind of music. The bass has a very satisfying tickle on the ear, very comfortable to wear as well. The fact that it has both 3.5mm jack and amplifier jack is awesome and very useful. Highly recommend these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Jernigan

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: My son uses these head phones and loves the comfortable headphones. He loves the long cord so he can move around in them.
customer_reviews.author: Kim B.

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: sounds great! full and rich sound. one small minus- after a period of time the ear and the surrounding area are getting a bit hot and need a few minutes to cool down :) I definitely would recommend this product to anyone who wants a great set of not so expensive headphones!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound - solid construction
customer_reviews.text: These headphones offer great sound with a comfortable fit. Their construction is solid and durable. I would recommend this headphones to other customers.
customer_reviews.author: Settled Nomad

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality assurence and very cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Felt really cheap and mine had loose bits of solder rattling around inside the ear cups.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Earnest

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, ok build quality, best price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great audio quality Self adjusting band Comfortable Long cable Cons: Pads are tearing a bit around the sides. (Have had these for less than a year.) Difficult to carry around
customer_reviews.author: Javier Meza

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband, and he said for the price they feel sturdy and great quality. It’s definitely an awesome buy. Have to try it for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: For the price excellent sound quality combined with
customer_reviews.text: For the price excellent sound quality combined with, being closed back, a reasonable level of attenuation of background sound. Tried quite a few other headphones in this price range and without going up substantially in price would definately recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: pics1

customer_reviews.title: OK at a pinch.
customer_reviews.text: Quality feel, but reproduction only average to my ears. Maybe I need to burm them in for longer but not enough depth or edge to the sound.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: $200 headphone for under $50.
customer_reviews.text: Confortable and light. Not the reachest sound compare to $200 or $300 headphones but acceptable. Easily in range of $100. Though, more flat and accurate, without enhancements in particular area.
customer_reviews.author: Med

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and great.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the product. If you don’t want to put so much money for a professional headphone, this one works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Can Bilici

customer_reviews.title: Most likely better off buying a better brand.
customer_reviews.text: Right speaker went out after 2 months of light use when i got off work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are great headphones. Really good bass. They fit comfortably over the ear. While not noise canceling, they block out a tremedouse amount of noise.
customer_reviews.author: Keith F Bamberger

customer_reviews.title: The sound was pretty reliable for me
customer_reviews.text: The sound was pretty reliable for me, but the right pad came off after some months of use, the sound quality is decent and I have not had any problems with it cutting out on one ear or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I use for my bass amp so I don't bother anyone good highs and lows
customer_reviews.author: marcus puente

customer_reviews.title: No bass.
customer_reviews.text: Bad sound quality don't buy if you're a bass head no bass my $50 Walmart Samsung banged harder
customer_reviews.author: Bath

customer_reviews.title: Help support from your guys there. They no have any idea to deal with returns
customer_reviews.text: Item was defective. I return it to amazon. Left side not working
customer_reviews.author: Yoed

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and sound decent
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive with decent quality sound. Very little sound bleed thanks to the snug ear cups and closed back design.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: Really good. I'm a big Akg fanboy and I love their stuff. They sound great
customer_reviews.author: Landon Moore

customer_reviews.title: It sounds better. A PLUS
customer_reviews.text: I use all HARMAN Related Products for my studio. HARMAN/AKG , It sounds better. A PLUS.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Cable connector easily broken
customer_reviews.text: Cable port is easily broken just 2 days of use... Got 2 headphones and had the same problem..i hope they would replace or repair this.
customer_reviews.author: joyce

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The headphones completely crapped out the first week of April less than 5 months of purchase. Very disappinted
customer_reviews.author: Sean Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Like the scr4ew on 1/4" adapter. Looks better than taping the others on. Very comfortable for hour plus sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flat sound
customer_reviews.text: Boxy sound. They are honestly not a good transparent pair. They sound flat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great but a little big for me
customer_reviews.text: They work great, as expected. I’m a petite woman and they’re a little too big for my head.
customer_reviews.author: Us4ever

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product for the price. Wonderful sound clear vocals and robust bass.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Has a great sound, long cable and some noise cancellation even ...
customer_reviews.text: Has a great sound, long cable and some noise cancellation even though it is not stated. Not the most comfortable but better than average.
customer_reviews.author: Santiago

customer_reviews.title: The headphones are great, sound powerfull and clear
customer_reviews.text: I live in Chile. Greetings to all of you. The headphones are great, sound powerfull and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Read before buying !!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Be careful ordering akg heaphones. I had owned a pair of k52s before I purchased these and those gave up on me fairly quick in a couple months.And i thought maybe that was just a bad pair I recieved. So i didn't let that expierence ruin what I thought about akg. I took a chance purchasing these, and let me tell you I was wrong. One side of the headphones was louder than the other, right out of the box. Very similar to what I expierenced with the k52s, this will be my last time buying from Akg. Invest on some other headphones, just not these .
customer_reviews.author: Domingo Jr Rojas

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound quality, supreme comfort.
customer_reviews.text: I've very pleased with this product I strongly reccomend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic

customer_reviews.title: Heavy in weight, uncomfortable, average sound.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are heavy and clumsy. What was I thinking? There is no way I could work with these for more than 15 minutes. Longer than that and I get a headache and stiff neck. I found I also had to increase the output volume on my Mac when I use these headphones. Not happy, will on sell second hand.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Divine

customer_reviews.title: Short lived and underwhelming
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is underwhelming, and the comfort could stand to be improved. The most important point, though, is that the sound in the right ear started dropping out after less than a month of light use.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Ebeling

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the audiophile snobs mislead you, these are amazing headphones for the money. The closed back design eliminates audio leakage and increases isolation. If you are recording or mixing, this is what you want. Frequency bandwidth is 16 to 22000 Hz, Sensitivity 113 dB SPL/V, impedance 32 Ohms. You aren't going to find better sounding headphones for the money. They have a 2 year warranty to boot. Oh and they are nice a comfy too.
customer_reviews.author: nerdburg

product_meta.title: AKG Pro Audio K92 Over-Ear, Closed-Back, Studio Headphones, Matte Black and Gold
product_meta.description: Size:K92Mix and master your tracks with uninhibited clarity with the AKG K92 over-ear, closed back headphones. Professional-grade 40mm drivers reveal even the subtlest nuances, so you can be confident your mix will translate accurately on any system. Whether you’re fine-tuning track levels within the mix or mastering the final product, the self-adjusting headband and lightweight design will provide hours of comfort. Designed by the company whose mics and headphones have helped create some of the world’s most iconic recordings, the durable K92 is a serious headphone that delivers great sound in the studio and beyond.
feature_bullets: Precisely balanced response provides reference-monitor accuracy
Professional 40mm drivers for extended 16Hz - 20kHz frequency response
Over-ear design and lightweight construction for exceptional comfort
